suncertify
Interface NetworkServer

All Known Implementing Classes:
RMINetworkServer
public interface NetworkServer

A network server responsible for sharing a server connection.

Method Summary
 ClientToServerConnection getServerConnection(java.lang.String ip, int port)
          Get a reference to the server connection.
 void initializeServer(int port)
          Perform any initialization required.
 void startServer(java.lang.String ip, int port, ClientToServerConnection connection)
          Start sharing the given connection on the given network port, using the ip address specified.
 void stopServer(java.lang.String ip, int port)
          Stop the server and prevent clients from connecting.
 

Method Detail

initializeServer

void initializeServer(int port)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Perform any initialization required. This method is called when the program starts up.

Parameters:
port - the networking port to be used
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a network problem

startServer

void startServer(java.lang.String ip,
                 int port,
                 ClientToServerConnection connection)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Start sharing the given connection on the given network port, using the ip address specified.

Parameters:
ip - the IP address of the server
port - the networking port to be used
connection - the server connection to share
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a network problem

stopServer

void stopServer(java.lang.String ip,
                int port)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       ServerNotRunningException
Stop the server and prevent clients from connecting.

Parameters:
ip - the IP address of the server
port - the networking port to be used
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a network problem
ServerNotRunningException - if the server has not been started

getServerConnection

ClientToServerConnection getServerConnection(java.lang.String ip,
                                             int port)
                                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                    ServerNotRunningException
Get a reference to the server connection.

Parameters:
ip - the IP address of the server
port - the networking port to be used
Returns:
a reference to the server connection
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is a network problem
ServerNotRunningException - if the server has not been started
